alert.note: Alert for Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 23 at 8:50PM EDT until March 29 at 6:48PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers... Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Newton and Iroquois Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING TO WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Iroquois River from Near US-41 downstream to confluence with Sugar Creek at Watseka, including the Iroquois gauge. * WHEN...From Saturday morning to Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.5 feet, County Road 1950N threatened north of Watseka. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Watch means water levels above flood stage are possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons along rivers and streams in the watch area should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by Friday afternoon.
